citation.article-title: Acrocarpospora gen. nov., a new genus of the order Actinomycetales.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Acrocarpospora pleiomorpha sp. nov.
Acrocarpospora pleiomorpha (ple.i.o.mor'pha. Gr. adj. pleion more; Gr. n. morphe form; M.L. fem. adj. pleiomorpha pleiomorphic, in various shapes)
Morphological, chemotaxonomic and general characteristics are as given above for the genus.
Glucose, raffinose, rhamnose and mannitol are utilized, but xylose, arabinose, sucrose, fructose and inositol are not.
As diagnostic phospholipids, phosphatidylethanolamine, ninhydrin-positive and sugar-positive phospholipids are present.
The G+C content of DNA is 69 mol%.
